a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Average test score in mathematics and science vs. GDP per capita,
Shown on the x-axis are Hanushek and Woessmann's combination of scores from international student achievement tests. The
scores are standardized to the PISA test scale, so that the OECD countries have a mean of 500 and a standard deviation of
100. The test scores are here plotted against GDP per capita in 2016, but the test scores are not from a particular year, and
instead are the average of all standardized math and science test scores each country participated in.
Average test score in math and science, primary through end of secondary school in 2016
Data source: Data compiled from multiple sources by World Bank, Hanushek and Woessmann (2012)
